cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: over the Gulf of Gonave heading for eastern Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn north-northwest then northwest, moving through the Bahamas and approaching Florida’s east-central coast late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the east-central Florida coast (around Brevard/Volusia counties)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Deerfield Beach FL northward to the Volusia/Brevard county line (includes Port Canaveral area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None along Florida coast (warnings limited to Haiti, Cuba and the Bahamas at this time)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and east-central Florida coast, Bahamas, later Georgia/South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (≥74 mph) possible late Thursday with tropical-storm-force winds arriving by early Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge 3–5 ft or higher along the barrier islands and inlets near Port Canaveral as the core passes just offshore
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches with isolated amounts up to 10 inches possible across east-central Florida including the port area
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, coastal erosion, and possible port closures or operational halts due to gale/hurricane conditions
